textbooks.title: Mathematics for Machine Learning
textbooks.authors: M. P. Deisenroth, A. A. Faisal, and C. S. Ong

topics: The Singular Value Decomposition and Applications

grading.policies: Late submissions will generally not be accepted.

policies.attendance: You are expected to attend live sessions and participate in discussions.
policies.late_work: Late submissions will generally not be accepted. If you are unable to complete an assignment on time, you must contact the instructor well in advance.
policies.academic_integrity: All work submitted must be written on your own and should not resemble anyone else's work. Cheating will not be tolerated.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for support.

instructor.name: Upendra Prasad
instructor.office_hours: See the course Canvas page for a Zoom link.

_metadata.course_description: This course provides students with the essential background in calculus and linear algebra needed to pursue the study of Data Science.
learning_outcomes: Perform algebraic operations on vectors and matrices
Distinguish vector subspaces and find bases for them
Calculate projection matrices and least squares estimates
Find eigenvalues and eigenvectors of square matrices, the eigen decomposition when possible, and the singular value decomposition of arbitrary matrices
Compute partial derivatives, gradients, and integrals of multivariate functions
Find Taylor polynomials and Taylor series of single variable and multivariable functions and use them to approximate functions
Optimize basic single variable and multivariable functions
